newsitem.title: JAPAN: Moody's confirms ratings of DKB.
newsitem.headline: Moody's confirms ratings of DKB.

text.p: Moody's Investors Service said on Friday it had confirmed the A1/Prime-1 deposit ratings and the C financial strength rating of Dai-Ichi Kangyo Bank Ltd (DKB).
The decision followed the Japanese Finance Ministry's announcement of administrative penalties against DKB on Wednesday for the bank's role in a racketeer payoff scandal.
The agency added that the outlook for the bank's ratings remains negative, it also said.

Moody's said the administrative sanctions should not affect DKB's financial fundamentals. DKB's current ratings incorporate the expectation that the bank will remain well-positioned to benefit from a rapidly deregulating environment, given its strength in both wholesale and retail banking.
